Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great value”
Reviews.Author: STLOOEY
Reviews.Content: We wanted to let the kids run around Branson--Ripley's, the Titanic Museum, Indoor Water Slide, etc. all very cheesy. However, we were shocked by how nice the Hilton was. And it was a great value--we had a huge two bedroom suite with a large connecting lounge with a nice kitchen for $180/night. If you are going to Branson, you won't find a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: MBarb10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well designed. The lobby is welcoming and the rooms appointed with modern Hilton finishes. The six pillows on the bed are an extra treat.Very high quality hotel compared to most in Branson. Only downside was the noisy HVAC. In-room in gurggled when kicking on. Also, the lower-numberd room __01, __02, __03, face the toof of the convention center, where a mechanical moter drones 24 hours a day. But I'll still stay here again. Great location to walk to downtown or Branson Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service until......”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelNebraska
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful, accommodating hotel with all the amenities. The food was great, the service was great and a very friendly staff. Our room was located by the elevator and ice machine and we didn't hear a sound. While there our only problem was the elevators were out of order quite a bit and when going to the workout room the ear phones which we were to get from the front desk were never in stock. Other than those minor happening we were very impressed until we left the hotel and when we got home realized we left our laundry bag hanging on the back of the bathroom door with soiled laundry inside. I right away called the hotel and left a message. They called back the next day and "yes" they found it and would return it via UPS. Over a week later we received a call from UPS saying someone turned in this package which was delivered to them. The wrong address had been put on the box. Upon opening it, we found all the soiled clothing but no laundry bag! Now this bag is special because my husband has had this since he was in the military over 40 years ago. Why would they dump out the clothing and not send the bag. I have called several times and either get an answering machine or a call back saying they would get back to me on that. Still no answer or bag. This may seem trivial to most but it is special to my husband. Will update with rave reviews if we retrieve the bag.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely classy.”
Reviews.Author: bikerhbm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. Branson is looking a little run down in parts, but this hotel is so luxurious. The lobby is gorgeous, the rooms were large/modern/pretty, the service great, the bedding beautiful, and we hung out with our 2 boys at the pool and in the fitness facility every day we were there. Everything was superb (though the restaurant was v.pricey). It was a really classy place to stay. I won't go back to Branson unless we stay there.

Reviews.Title: “If you're Diamond Hhonors, forget feeling special here...”
Reviews.Author: gkcgtg
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice enough, but overall not your best choice for Branson and there are better values, even in the semi-luxury hotel tier. And if you're a Hhonors Diamond member expecting to get a little extra love, forget it. You will be charged for parking, and breakfast for everyone except the member - $18 for a kid's froot loops is ridiculous no matter who you are. And while they made a big deal of upgrading our room upon check-in, when I compared the room with the photos when I booked (I have gotten smart to always save this history based on other previous experiences), they were the same, so I have no idea what that was about. The desk and restaurant staff were the least helpful I've seen but the Bellmen were among the best and made up for the surly attitude of the others. The location is far away from most attractions except the shopping. Expect to spend a lot of time in traffic as a result. I mean A LOT... The best surprise bonus of the hotel - the views are extraordinary above the 5th floor and the Starbucks is right across the street! For free, I definitely stay again but if my $$ or points are on the line, I'd look elsewhere first...

Reviews.Title: “Nickle & Dime = Arm & Leg”
Reviews.Author: Myra W
Reviews.Content: I know that many high end hotels think it’s ok to charge for parking and internet, but I do not. If it were NYC where no one has a car to park, that would be one thing, but this is Branson. Everyone has one! You can expect to pay for the little things here. Forgive me, but that’s just cheep to do that to your guests. Now that that’s off my chest... The room was all you would expect from a $200 a night room. It was clean and pleasant in every way. The bed was ultimately comfortable. I do not remember waking up once. The location was easy walking from the landing and all of the shops and restaurants therein. As long as you go in with your eyes open, I recommend the Hilton. One note, We were tuckered out from a busy day and chose to order a pizza. The Hilton will not allow Dominoes to come up to your room. You must descend to the lobby to get it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: corkdeb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond my expectations...the rooms were lovely and beautifully appointed. I requested a room overlooking the lake and the landing, which we were given. The beds were very comfortable and the toiletries in the bathroom were high-end. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Branson, and I would also recommend THIS Hilton above the Branson Landing Hilton. I have stayed there and like the convention center one much more. HOWEVER, the hotel in my opinion was remiss in giving us a room next to a barking dog. We were there in mid-January when Branson was not busy and the hotel had plenty of rooms. So why we were put next door to a barking dog (I was unaware that the hotel was dog friendly) is beyond me. We called the front desk and they immediately tried to resolve the situation with the barking dog's parents, but if it continued to be a problem, then they would happily move us. Personally, I thought they should move the barking dog people, but that was not offered. Anyway, aside from a few "yips" late at night, it went away. But all in all, just ask for a room that is not next to a barking dog.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Classy in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Anna B
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Branson and I thoroughly enjoyed it. My two kids had a great time!! The Hilton was clean, classy and we loved the included breakfast (you have to purchase the breakfast package). The pool was nice also. There were only two problems during our stay...on Sunday there was a loud techno pool party (not kid friendly) and wireless internet is not complimentary. Other than that it was convenient, friendly and upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FourWinds_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice in Branson. Staff had trouble with their computers and it took forever to check-in, but they comped our parking for the inconvenience. (Self-parking is conveniently located just across the street.) Staff also comped internet after we told them our reservations agent had assured us that internet service was included. Staff was helpful throughout, with good directions to avoid some of the traffic, and helpful suggestions about Branson entertainment. Beds were comfy, and our room was immaculate. Breakfast buffet was fresh and delicious. Also try breakfast at Clockers Cafe, about a block uphill from the Hilton. Great food, good value, and super friendly wait staff. Hotel location is an easy walk to the Landing, but allow enough time to drive to many of the main entertainment venues. Traffic is horrendous and very slow on the main road from the Hilton up to an hour before show times. Staff can suggest shortcuts to some of the theaters. There was no concierge on duty during our stay, but desk and valet staff were all very knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Randy K
Reviews.Content: Recently we attended a prayer conference at the Branson Convention Center. We stayed at the Hilton for 5 nights and greatly enjoyed our stay. The rooms are decorated well and are very clean. If you don't mind spending a little more for a very nice place this will be a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice people!”
Reviews.Author: JB5916
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - they went above and beyond for me after I had to find another room in Branson at the last min. Even gave me free parking!!!! Also quiet, never heard a sound and there were about 400 teenage cheerleaders while I was here!

Reviews.Title: “Met or exceeded expectation”
Reviews.Author: parafrog
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to tourist attractions, this property successfully balances the differing needs of three distinct demographics (convention, tourist, business) providing a superb stay. It appears the other Hilton located adjacent is geared to solely the tourist trade. Self parking was located just across the street; the valet service was prompt, courteous and professional. The front staff was well trained and personable, the common areas well thought out and impressive. The property was immaculate. I stayed in a two room suite (1109) facing the river and tourist district. Despite this, there was no discernable road noise. The room(s) may well be the most spacious and well appointed I have ever encountered in the Hilton family of hotels. If there for business (as I was), there is no need to leave the hotel; ample food and beverages are available both being well prepared although expect the “Hilton plus-up” tariff. The menu selections were somewhat less robust than usually found at Hiltons focusing on differing variations of a “red meat” theme. A vignette: There was a time change during my stay and I had an early morning flight; as such I was concerned about oversleeping. The desk placed not only an electronic wakeup call but also personally called. That speaks to the level of customer service. A benchmark Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new”
Reviews.Author: jgil
Reviews.Content: No real complaints or surprises. Hotel is fairly new so everything is well kept and modern. The workout area was a little small but it was clean. Great location near the landing and plenty of restaraunts around. I came back to the landing a few weeks later and stayed at the Hilton promenade and liked it a little better. Seemed to hear less through the walls but it could all be in my head?

Reviews.Title: “A typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Kilty249
Reviews.Content: We were here for 6 nights in September. It was our 1st visit to Branson, so decided to play it safe and stay in a Hilton. Our room was lovely and large. We had requested a balcony room, which we got but ours looked over the rail line which was not really picturesque. The staff were great, especially the valets, they were very friendly and gave great directions. No reason not to stay there if we returned to Branson, but we would probably give the Hilton at Branson Landing a try.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lesndave
Reviews.Content: Husband, granddaughter, and I stayed here in October 2011. We had a king deluxe w/sofabed on the 12th floor. Loved everything about it except the shower. The shower head comes out of the wall about 7 feet high, meaning it is almost impossible to reach so that it could be adjusted. It was spraying out forward and to the wall, because I am fairly short the spray had dispersed to the point that it was hard to rinse my hair. Also you have to reach in the shower to turn it on, getting sprayed with water before you have the chance to adjust the temp., and shaving your legs is very difficult. All they need to do to fix this is put in a hand held nozzle. Problem solved. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. The location was great. Valets went out of their way to be helpful and courteous. Fix the shower issue and I would give this place the highest rating possible!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BigDaveOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights here and we were very impressed with every aspect of this hotel. But the thing that stood out more than anything was the staff, especially the valet attendants. Big, clean room, beautiful lobby, very nice indoor pool & hot tub and again, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: christymfowler
Reviews.Content: Room 526 was very roomy and clean and quiet. Everything was in working order except someone had locked the safe in the OPEN position so you could not close it and set your own code. Maintenance came up quickly and fixed it. The room did not have a bathtub and that was not disclosed when making the reservation. I like to take a bath at night after working out, but this was not a big deal. One evening I took a very late shower (after 11:00PM) and it took the hot water at least 3 minutes to be warm enough where I could stand under it.. I was almost to the point of getting out and calling the front desk to report I had no hot water. It SLOWLY changed from freezing to cool to lukewarm to hot. Not sure what the problem was, but it was minor and only happened once. Convention Center was very nice. No complaints. My only beef is that I arrived at nearly 1AM. I was alone and self-parked in the garage and took the skybridge over. This puts you in the convention center, not the hotel. It was very dark and deserted and a little creepy. Nothing happened, but this would be a great spot for a mugger to situate themselves. I realize that lighting a giant space is costly, but so are assaults, should they happen. Could walk to many restaurants, bars, and shops. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Southerncynt
Reviews.Content: WOW! The hotel & location is great. Service was upscale but real! Keep up the great job. Mitchell Family

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Venue”
Reviews.Author: Cargotraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a convention at the Hilton Branson Convention Center and enjoyed the experience, although there are definitely trade-offs to the choice of this hotel. I'll start by saying that anytime you are going to visit an area that emphasizes the tourisrm industry, you're going to find yourself having to pay for amenities. The Hilton is no exception. Upon arriving, we found that valet parking is available, as is parking that is closer to the entrance. Valet parking was quoted at $12 per day and covered parking at $8 per day. The hotel does have free parking on the far side of the convention center. If you opt for the free parking, be prepared for a hike. I found that it took approximately ten minutes from the time I left the room to the time I made it to the car each trip that I made. Internet is charged at a rate of $10 per day. During check in, we were offered our choice of free internet or free covered parking in lieu of housekeeping services during our stay, so you have your choice of parking, internet (WIFI) or clean towels. The hotel is also "pet friendly" which is either a plus when you are traveling with Fido or a curse if you don't like dogs in your hotel. The hotel is located near the Branson Landing and the old downtown area and both are within easy walking distance. The hotel also has a fitness center, business center, swimming pools, two bars and a restaurant. Additionally, the convention center can hold any sized event. The staff at the hotel is first rate. Everyone that I encountered was friendly and courteous. The convention staff was first rate and the meals and snacks provided during the convention were superior. The room that I stayed in was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I also had a choice of varying degrees of softness to firm pillows on the bed. The room was equipped with a small refrigerator. The bathroom was large and well lit. I was also pleased with the cleanliness of the room as well as the overall appearance of the hotel. The only real drawback to the hotel was that there is one bank of four elevators to get you to your room from the convention center and the lobby. With large numbers of convention goers, the elevators are really taxed and you can find yourself waiting for quite some time to be transported.It is unfortunate that there are not additional elevators located near the middle of the convention center, as that would have greatly improved the logistics of getting people moved from convention venue to their rooms. All in all, the hotel was one that I would happily come back to in the future. If you are looking for a convention site, I don't think you could go wrong with a decision to book your event here.

Reviews.Title: “Only one thing missing!”
Reviews.Author: Arkies10
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel and the room was extremely nice, well furnished, great amenities, great bathroom and lighting. The bed was one of the most comfortable that I had slept in. It was a great location for us as we wanted to walk through the Landing as well as the historic downtown parts, and really didn't have an interest in any of the music shows. I will say they really need to wash the windows, as in the mornings with the sun coming up, you could barely see out the window for the dirt. The one huge disappointment was their restaurant...it was supposed to be "fine dining" and the decor and ambiance definitely made you feel like you were in for a treat, but the food was mediocre at best and my husband (who is NOT picky), just could not eat his stuffed pork chop because he thought it might be bad/old...and I must say it had an odd flavor. Everything else was great - the staff was very polite and efficient as well as courteous and pleasant. I would give them a try again, but I suggest they look for a new chef/manager for their restaurant. After speaking with a freind that lives only a few miles outside of Branson, he had the same thing to say about the food at the restaurant. He had their steaks, which is suppose is their specialty, but he said that was also just mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS OK”
Reviews.Author: traveleyesok
Reviews.Content: The first time we went to this hotel, it was great. Room was very clean, stayed on the 10th floor with a balcony and a good view of the river. The second time we went over Labor Day, or room was on the 4th floor, overlooking the street. The room was smaller, no couch etc and had a terrible smell. It smelled like a wet dog. This hotel is "pet friendly" so I don't know if that was the problem or not? We had to call the front desk to have them come spray something in the room to cover it up. Also the air conditioning wasn't working probably, no matter what we set it on, it kicked off after a few minutes and wouldn't keep the room cool. We will probably go back, but be more specific on our room type next time. It weasn't a total deal breaker, but could be better. Also don't like having to pay for parking! The breakfast in the steak house of the hotel was just average a best and way too expensive for what you get! Awesome hotel location, can easily walk to Branson Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barb W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 day convention and was truly impressed with this hotel. Great facility for a smaller scale convention. Hotel is very clean, staff extremely friendly and helpful. Easy access to the Branson Landing shopping - it's just across the street. Rooms are beautiful, spacious, clean and quite. I was extremely happy with my stay and will return for pleasure too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with lots to do, new facility”
Reviews.Author: mscalhoun
Reviews.Content: We were in Branson for a wedding that was held at the Hilton Convention center. What a great hotel. It was fairly new and in a great location that was near the shops. There was a Starbucks across the street. My daughter was in the wedding and my wife and I had plenty to do while she was with the bridal party. The convention area was also very nice. Large and open but nice. food int he restaurants was great and the rooms were clean and exceptional as well. Great hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Bob050
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Branson for the fourth time and found the Hilton Convention Center to be the best hotel that we have ever stayed at in Branson. We had a very spacious room overlooking the river in old town Branson just blocks away from the "Landing" and many shops and restaurants. The check in staff was great and the valet service was prompt. We were on the 9th floor with a balcony overlooking the river. The street noise was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay. Average for meetings”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Branson Convention Center is a very nice hotel with great rooms. The facility is showing some signs of aging (scuffed walls and doors and some frayed carpeting) but in general is still a very nice location. The hotel is right in the middle of Branson with easy access to both the waterfront and the old Branson shopping areas. Staff are very friendly and they are very aware of guests needs and respond quickly and professionally. If you are upgrading to a suite do not get an end room as they do not have a balcony and stay on the street side (positive numbers) as the trains come through in the middle of the night and are very noisy Suites are a good option because they have a limited kitchen with dining area. This is a great option for families that want to save on meals..Since Branson is family orientated expect families and children and the associated noise. There are some downsides to this facility There is an 8.00 self parking charge per day that can go up to 12.00 if you use valet. The restaurants are very well maintained but expensive. The Breakfast buffet is not very good the bagels were stale and the choices limited. If you decide to have breakfast make sure to order an omelet or other breakfast offerings from your waiter as it is part of the buffet.(my waiter failed to mention that) For meetings the hotel needs some improvements. The meeting rooms are quite far from the hotel elevators and for many meetings the professional displays are in public areas. This is difficult as all supplies etc must be removed daily as there is no security and these areas are open to the public. Most of the food and break services were also in the public areas and without staff to supervise the break areas people from different groups and the public would visit and use these services that other groups were paying for. The design of these areas were not conducive to business as the general public would enter the exhibits. I enjoyed the hotel and staff but were prefer to visit as a tourist rather than as a exhibitor at a professional meeting..

Reviews.Title: “PREMIER BRANSON HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Caricky
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff extremely friendly especially, MaLinda Hebert (front desk supvr). Very clean hotel and rooms very nice and quiet. Fairly new property.

Reviews.Title: “Typical convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spousetoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed last weekend here for the first time (I do a lot of conventions). The rooms are spacious, and do have a mini-fridge with room for your coke or bottle of wine. The bathrooms are spacious. The parking is pricey, and although the skywalk to the lot is nice, it means you have to walk by the registration area that most conventions will use, so you cannot come and go to your car from your room without walking thru the convention center, unless you choose to walk outside. That's not always something you want to do, particularly if you are carrying stuff back and forth from your room to your car (or if you are sneaking out and back from the convention hoping no one will notice!). You have to pay for internet in the room -- not unusual for a convention hotel -- and it's a standard rate. But don't bother asking about wifi in the convention center -- it's operated by the City of Branson, NOT the Hilton, and the connection in the convention center is $40/day! Seriously! Thank God for aircards! it is close to the Branson Landing and it is across the street from Starbucks -- a lifesaver! Check out Plum Beads across the street! Fantastic shop!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for keeping off the tourist strip”
Reviews.Author: meadow318
Reviews.Content: I have been to Branson many times on fishing trips on the Taney and never knew this side of Branson existed. Great, fresh hotel. Friendly staff even upgraded me to a suite that was as big as a one bedroom apartment. Even had an extra powder room at the entrance, along with a soaker tub and shower in the master bathroom. Walking distance from many shopping venues and restaurants without having to go to the other side of town and get in the long, congested traffic scene. Safe and secure parking, but pricey. Pool area was clean during day but got pretty rowdy in the evenings. What could one expect during the summer anyway. Restaurant buffet was nice, but also pricey. There are many other local places to dine worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjandljtravels
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Branson Hilton in early August 2011 for three nights. Overall, the hotel is very nice. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are clean. The hotel is fairly new and everything is in great condition. The hotel is only a few feet from the shops and restaurants on the river. The pools are very nice - especially the outdoor one, which was very large. Excercise facility is also good-sized with new equipment (TVs on machines, etc). I would have preferred a few more ameneties in the pool changing area - the changing area being very small also. Staffing - The staff was all very helpful but I was struck by how few staff members appeared to be on duty in the lobby. For being a "full service" hotel, it was low on staff members. Usually only one person working the desk and the one or two bell man who helped with luggage and valet often seemed to be hard to find. Once or twice there was a line waiting on valet car pickups. Having said this I would stress again that what staff they did have did a great job. It just felt like in the lobby that you were in a ghost town relative to staff. Restaurant - The Level 2 restaurant offered a great - but expensive - dinner. It is priced like a high-end steak house so be prepared. Breakfast was great - but I was annoyed that they charged full price ($15) for my young daughter. It is cheaper to order off the menu for breakfast and just as good. For both meals - the food was excellent, however. From what I could see of the other hotels, the Branson Hilton looks like the best hotel in town.

Reviews.Title: “Are You Kiddin me!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DJRCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have been the finest I have stayed at in years!!! Great staff, front desk, cleaning staff, bell hops etc. First rate accommodation! Excellent amenities.........pool, fitness center. On top of it all..an exceptional location. My only small beef is the parking situation........$8 bucks a day or something like that for the parkade and $10 a day for in room wi fi. All in all........a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel,excellant service”
Reviews.Author: suzyh66
Reviews.Content: this was the second time we stayed at this hilton.the last time was 3 years ago.both times we received wonderful service. its located at the landing and is very safe and near everything.they have two pools, one inside and out. there is also a workout room and hottubs,all very clean. towels are available at the pools.i was very impressed by all the employees,

Reviews.Title: “Underated on tripadvisor!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brock j
Reviews.Content: We are from Springfield (about 40 miles south of Branson) and therefore quite familiar with Branson. While other hotels have their place, if you are looking for luxury in Branson there are three choices (excluding condo rentals) Chateau on the Lake, Hilton Promenade, and Hilton Convention Center. Its that simple. However, all three are not represented well on tripadvisor. With very few exceptions, comparing this hotel with others area hotels is apples and oranges. The hotel is striking, amenities plentiful; everything is new, crisp, and comfortable. In every experience we have had, the service has been very good. Im not saying there are not issues to be ironed out but overall, this hotel is a long awaited departure from all the other motels/hotels on the strip and the Landing (nearby) is a wealth of unique activity.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - hard to remember that you are in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: Triptek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business meeting and my staff was blown away by the elegant hotel in this prime location in Branson. 1st of all, wou can get to the hotel easily without fighting the Hwy 76 traffic, and the efficient check-in got you quickly to your beautiful room. We had both King rooms and King Suites. The King room is huge with large tv and elegant bath. The King suites are outrageous - The have a bedroom with bath containing a soaking tub and separate shower. A 2nd half bath in the entry - a living room kitchen combo area with a Sofa Sleeper, TV dining Table, Full size refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave and glasses and dishes. There is an adequate fitness room and an indoor and outdoor pool, each with hot tub. You are steps from Branson Landing and a short drive to shows, shopping and entertainment. Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: EDJtraveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in at least a dozen hotels and vacation rentals in Branson over the past 10 years, including two of the city's other nicest accommodations -- Chateau on the Lake and Big Cedar Lodge. Room and facility-wise the Hilton Branson Convention Center is my favorite. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and luxurious. The outdoor pool is great for the family with lots of room and seating for the adults. The service from the front desk staff and housekeeping is excellent. In addition to the quality of the rooms, the location is terrific. Granted, the other resorts I mentioned earlier are on the lake, so in some instances that may be the way to go, but we love the fact that the Hilton is just across from Branson Landing's shopping and restaurants, as well as the wonderful old Downtown Branson area. If your focus isn't water activities, you can't beat the Hilton's location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & beautiful, new property”
Reviews.Author: minnow1982
Reviews.Content: This wonderful, Hilton property is right across the street from Branson Landing and the lake. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows, framing beautiful views. We had a corner room with balcony overlooking the lake & Landing area. The room was huge and the balcony was perfect for a drink at sunset. We commented it was one of the nicest hotel rooms we'd stayed in (and that includes a lot of "luxury" hotels). The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ordered room service once for breakfast and it was prompt and delicious. We were there for two nights and basically for R&R. There is an indoor & outdoor pool, there aren't many chairs at either so claim them early. The location is fantastic as the Landing is right across the street and the Branson Scenic Railway station is right outside the front door. We walked across the street for lunch, shopping and watching the Bellagio-like fountains. Another couple at the pool was staying in the Hilton at Branson Landing which is across the street. They said they had a room with a kitchenette but there wasn't a pool there - and they wished they had stayed at this property because of the proximity to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: RastamanInKansas
Reviews.Content: This was a nice find in a sea of average Branson hotels. Tried to get a room at Big Cedar but they were full so ended up at Hilton Branson Convention Center. Was assigned the 8th floor with a nice view of the lake. Pool was very nice for being tucked into a pretty small area. High price unless you find a good special rate (I used HiltonHonors Family MVP). Half a block from Branson Landing as well as old downtown Branson. $8 for self parking across the street. There was a train that came through in the middle of the night that blew its horn for what seemed like forever.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything but the shower and the noise”
Reviews.Author: japw82
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and loved everything this time except the shower and the noise. Everyone on staff was very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful, The room was clean and inviting. The furnishings and bedding were very comfortable. The bathroom was a big negative. It was tiny with a shower that wasn't at all user friendly. It was long and narrow and it was impossible to reach the faucet without physically entering the shower which made it difficult to regulate the water temp prior to entering. This was due to the shower door being on the opposite end of the shower because of the shower being wedged next to the commode with there being only one place for the door to be placed. The room next to us was occupied by a group of noisy drunk people. Thank goodness we didn't have children with us because the "F" bomb was being used fluently and loudly. Fortunately, they settled down around midnight and vacated the room the next morning. The Hilton properties at Branson Landing do a good job. Their properties are a notch above other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Wedding Night!!!”
Reviews.Author: Derek C
Reviews.Content: We arrived Saturday July 2, 2011 around 9:30 PM (After our Wedding). We were tired and hungry. At Check-In, the staff member waived the Internet Access Fee and provided us with complementary Valet Parking. We went to the room and settled in comfortably. I decided to go on a stroll around the hotel and found a very nice restaurant on the second floor. I thought this would be a good time to earn some bonus points for the Wedding Night, so I requested a reservation for 10:00 PM, wherein they closed at 11:00 PM. I asked, " Do you have any of those tall candles, and would it be possible to get a bottle of wine chilled"? The hostess said, "Of Course and No, we just have the small candles on each table". I was fine with this, and selected our favorite vineyard of wine. (Willamette Valley Vineyards). I went to the room and acted casual and said, "Hey, let’s go get some food at the restaurant downstairs". She was hungry, so we went down. As we arrived my wife was about to say, "Reservation for Two", when the hostess said, "Mr. Cooper, Your table is ready". My wife gave me a funny look as we walked to our table. When we arrived the hostess and manager had managed to grab all the candles on the tables and put them in the shape of a heart. My wife and I loved this very much. The food was excellent. We both started with a bowl of Tomato Bisque, and for the two entree's we had Duck and Almond encrusted Chicken topped with a generous portion of Dungeness Crab. Delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here Several Times”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTulsa
Reviews.Content: This is our get away hotel when we come to Branson. It has a super location just across from the Branson Landing. Which has lots of things to do and places to eat, from high end to street fair. We always stay in the Suites which are on the top floor with such great views. The staff is super! The rooms are great! You can't go wrong with these guys

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with Great Lake View”
Reviews.Author: otter941
Reviews.Content: 11th floor corner room was exceptional. Small balcony for morning coffee, but a bit bright and hot with morning sun streaming through the double paned glass. Big King Bed with room for 2 small poodles to romp. Excellent Soundproofing: Very quiet during a convention period. Housekeeping EXCELLENT as was Bellmen staff. Quite accommodating to various needs. Parking charged per day at parking lot across street. Short walking access to Branson Landing, where there are excellent restaurants. Brass Pro Shop available for shopping, right next to the best fish restaurant on Landing. Candlestick Inn Restaurant across the lake visible from room; which also offers wonderful pasta and fish; and steaks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and sleep!”
Reviews.Author: joks1
Reviews.Content: Was fortunate enough to get a room with a balcony overlooking Branson Landing. Was nice enough to sit out side each evening and morning sipping coffee. Room was clean, quiet enough. Great location to stay if you want to stroll around the downtown and the landing. Staff always greeted me with a smile and question. No problems at all to report. Oh, and the "self" parking garage is right next to the Valet parking garage a few steps across the street, unless you absolutely have to have valet parking, the Self park at $8 was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, average hilton honors program benefits”
Reviews.Author: travelfanarkansas
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hitel frequently. Love this place. The balcolny rooms are wonderful. If you r part of hilton honors program beware of the free breakfast. They will try to upcharge you when you dont want to. The bkft is the.only disappointment in our stays.

Reviews.Title: “You are Charging me, for Internet Access?????”
Reviews.Author: cusingeorge
Reviews.Content: This is the one reason I won't be back to this hotel. $10.00 for 24 hours? I can go to a Super 8 and get internet for free, F-R-E-E. Why should I pay $140.00 a night and not get this? The accommodations are no better than Drury or Hampton, that I can get for $100.00 plus the other things that are FREE. Sorry Hilton, you blew it this time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, room, facilities”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelNebraska
Reviews.Content: The service was very accomodating, our room was great, nice location to restaraunts and shopping. Friends in another room had some sort of bothersome noice from the plumbing that kept them awake most of the time. Most of the convention meals were good - not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very sharp hotel in a cool location”
Reviews.Author: kctraveler311
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 10th anniversary at the Hilton Branson Convention Center. This included a stay over New Years eve and New Years Day. The hotel is very nice, very clean, very roomy. Our room (double beds) was immaculate every day, and everything seemed brand new. Beautiful hotel and decor. Downside is that they charge for wi-fi and even to get on the net in their business center. They also charge for parking, however we chose to park at the convention center lot which was free (althought its a block and a half or so to walk, you can cut thru the convention center). Be aware that they won't mention this free lot to you but will instead try to sell you on the paid parking. We didn't use the workout facility or pool/hotub, although they looked very nice. Restaurant also looked very nice, but again out of our price range. We we enjoyed the short walk to various Branson Landing restaurants. We didn't have much interaction with staff, but when we did they were pleasant. Overall this is a very nice hotel in a great location, but they charge for some of the conveniences that other hotels offer complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dannifer
Reviews.Content: The title of my review pretty much sums it up. But what do you expect from a Hilton?! (Of course I'm not used to staying at hotels this nice.) They were having a sale through their website and if you can get that it's great! The building is of course beautiful - very high, we were on the 9th floor (not even close to the top I don't think) with a great view. It's also fairly new so very clean, modern, etc. Great showers, nice bathrooms, big flat screen tv. No complaints except maybe the parking. The only parking available is a parking garage across the street that is $8 a day! It always seems rediculous to me to pay more for a higher end hotel and then they don't provide free parking. (I mean, come on, the cheap hotels provide free parking.. shouldn't it be the other way around?) And while I'm on this, they don't provide complimentary breakfast or free wi-fi either, like the cheaper hotels (again, shouldn't it be the other way around?!) Ok, moving on - anyway, they do at least warn you about the extra parking fee on their website when you book so it's not a surprise. And of course it's within walking distance of the beautiful promenade shopping at Branson Landing and the river which is always a bonus. So I guess if you have the bucks, the stay is awesome. I will probably wait for a better discount to off set all the extra's that don't come free. :)

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hotel-no comparison”
Reviews.Author: Ebazinam
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the penthouse suites as an anniversary gift to ourselves. It was equipped with a full kitchen and dining area. There was one bedroom off of the fully equipped living area, with a king size bed. One Bathroom with a walk-in shower and bathtub. The living area and the bedroom were equipped with 55" televisions that could be observed throughout both areas. The living area had a fold out couch/bed for additional guests. Both rooms were ringed with "floor to ceiling" plate glass windows for an unforgettable view of the city and the river. The rate per night was $240 plus tax. The room was exceptionally clean and well taken care of. A minor dissapointment was that there wasn't a washer/dryer in the room. The hotel is well within walking distance of the landing and was well within walking distance of the local Starbucks (although it was very busy every morning-and did not handle a line very well at all). The hotel staff was very friendly at all times. The hotel had an indoor and an outdoor pool with an indoor hot tub. Ironically the outdoor pool was kept at a much better temperature than the indoor pool (which was freezing cold). The hot tub could accomodate about 4 people. The fitness facility was equipped with modern equipment, that had little wear and tear. The convention facility area was very expansive and could facilitate a very large conference if needed. The hotel had an upscale restaurant (never tried it though), and a bar on the second floor, just off of the main conference walkway. Overall, i would definately stay here again. The penthouse suite was well worth it for any kind of week/weekend outing.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: JRArkansas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for some shopping and shows in Branson over Thanksgiving holiday. We loved this hotel and the wonderful location. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Starbucks just across the street was very nice and convenient. Only thing unfavorable worth mentioning was the self-parking fee of $8, however, it is covered parking and attached to the hotel so there is some added value to that...

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel with very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: kauniit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Branson in September for two nights during our trip in the USA. The hotel is perfectly situated at the Branson Landing. Should you not go for a show, you don´t actually need to leave the hotel in the evening, since the food and the atmosphere in the Hilton restaurant are very good. Afterwards if you want to go to the bar, yes, the ladies, who worked at the bar, were very friendly and service minded. The vallet service was most friedly, and gave us very good information about the surrounds etc. What was a very nice gesture from the reception was the fact that there was no extra charge for the vallet service for the two nights. I had at that time "only" a silver vip by Hilton (after the trip I am now Gold vip!) This hotel is very recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations on all fronts”
Reviews.Author: kimsanjose
Reviews.Content: This is really a stunning property, not at all a "convention center" style hotel. The decor is well-conceived and executed. Although modern in style, the effect overall is very soothing. Great attention was even paid to the lay-out and decor of the fitness center and indoor pool area, amazing! Rooms are spacious and upscale. Beds are sublime. The service is top-notch. The staff is very well trained and professional while also exuding the charm of the area. They went out of their way to please at all levels -- housekeeping, valet, bell staff, front desk. Valet parking is a major bargain, only $2 more per day than self parking and we never waited more than 3 minutes for our car to appear. The location is ideal as it is just across from Branson Landing with many lovely shops and restaurants. However, recommend you don't stray too far from Level 2, the restaurant at the hotel. We had several lovely meals there (tried breakfast, lunch, dinner, all good). The food is top quality, ambience is great, and service is very good. The steaks are terrific quality and perfectly cooked. The only drawback is that the chef has a heavy hand with salt (and this is coming from a real salt addict) so ask that he restrain himself a bit when you order. We stayed here 5 nights and could have easily stayed 5 more. Hated to leave, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - will go back”
Reviews.Author: Allison29631
Reviews.Content: Very Nice, Perfect location, beautiful setting. In my opinion, anyone that would give a bad review, would probably complain about everything.

Reviews.Title: “more charming than the brochure implies”
Reviews.Author: imabee
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by Hilton Branson Convention Center hotel. I have to admit, as an avid traveler I'm not sure what to expect - it is beautiful! The hotel is immaculate and has a rugged, modern finish. We ate at Level 2 (the hotel's steak house) and they even allow guests to choose their "weapon" (steak knife) of choice - eat there 5 times and they will engrave it for you and have your specific knife available the next time you come! I had the fish special, fantastic! After dinner I hopped across the street (literally across the street) to the Promenade - the shopping and nightly water show is not to be missed! My hotel room was a gorgeous suite, complete with it's own balcony and I headed outside to sit next to the pool (a bit chilly for a dip) and they had a nice fire going. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: pibi63040
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location, spacious room, lovely restaurant and a super location next to Branson Landing.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway weekend with friends”
Reviews.Author: travelerstreet
Reviews.Content: I used Hilton Honors points to stay at this hotel. I was greeted by very friendly staff and as a Gold member was upgraded to a king one bedroom condo. Room had a separate living room with couch, chair, dining room table for 4, full size fridge, microwave, sink and dishwasher. There was a half bath in the hall which was nice since we shared the room with another couple. The couch in the living room was a fold out so that is where they slept. The separate bedroom with king bed had its own bathroom. Very spacious and comfy bed. View was great of the Landing and Lake Taneycomo. Valet was $12 but decided to use it because it was convenient. Was a little disappointed to find out that our hotel door didn't close like most do behind you. We returned from dinner to find our door ajar. You had to slam the door to close it. We also requested that our sofa bed be made out for our guests while we were at dinner which did not get done. Really enjoyed the location. Right across the street from the Landing. Great indoor and outdoor pool and hot tub. Pool was huge. There was also a fire pit outside by the pool which was would be nice to use at night. We ate the breakfast buffet which was very good. Overall a really great stay. I have also stayed at the Promenade which is right on the Landing and I think I liked this hotel better. I felt like this hotel had better amenities and the Promenade is too spread out. I also got much better service at this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel in Branson !!!”
Reviews.Author: momof2z
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hilton Branson Convention Center this year. This hotel is awesome. It's clean, rooms are large and they even have one bedroom condo rooms on the top 3 floors. The staff is friendly and very attentive. There is an indoor and a wonderful outdoor pool and spa/whirlpools at both. You can self park in the convention center lot for free, and you have a short walk inside through the convention center or you can pay for the deck or valet parking. Rooms are nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. Beds are a little soft for me. We have booked the King condo with small kitchen for both our stays. It's perfect for families with lots of room to move about. Location is perfect for dining and shopping, many choices within walking distance across the street in the Branson Landing District. During the summer, rates are higher but check for discounts in early spring! It's certainly worth the extra $$ to stay here, and our family would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will highly recommend this property”
Reviews.Author: AntigoLS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met my sister and her husband for a relaxing week in Branson. We did not stay at the Hilton but decided to stop by to look at the hotel and to have dinner at their Level2 Steakhouse. The property is beautiful and very clean, the staff super helpful, the location excellent .... the waterfront shops and downtown historic Branson are steps away. And I think their Level2 restaurant has to be the best in Branson. Excellent food and service and a very nice wine list. I will recommend this location to everyone visiting Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Fun on over the 4th”
Reviews.Author: at.reichardt
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, next to the Landing. It’s a short trip to the strip and the shows. Very clean hotel. The hotel is new and the rooms and the lobby are very modern. Cons: No guest laundry facilities on site (they recommended a Laundromat). No breakfast service. No free Wi-Fi. They have nice 32" LCD TV's but no HD service. We had a nice stay a very visually appealing property. The stay could have been outstanding had the Hotel provided some of the amenities other hotels provide in the normal course of business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mstud21
Reviews.Content: I used H Honors points to get a room for two nights for my wife and I was able to get free internet access with my Diamond VIP status, otherwise they charge $9.95 per day. Free continental breakfast is upgradeable to the so-so full American buffet for $6.00. We only did this for the convenience factor. The staff was very professional and courteous as you would expect at a Hilton property. We thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay!

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: ganny60
Reviews.Content: Great views from this hotel include downtown shops, the river, carriage rides and train rides. The hotel is the number 4 hotel in the Hilton chain. Very friendly staff and rooms are clean and beautiful. Refrigs in each room. Most rooms do not have microwaves. My father had a balcony room. Short walking distance to the landing with free fountain lights show each night. There was a free concert one night of our stay. No need to attend shows, plenty to do right on the landing. Lots of places to eat within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: IcebergSlim06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to extend our honeymoon in the Branson area for another night and decided to stay at this location. (It is noteworthy to mention that this hotel is directly across the street to the landing/boardwalk/riverwalk.) Let me start off by saying thank you to the young lady (name started with an X) at the front desk for giving us complimentary valet parking since we were on our honeymoon. This is a very nice hotel. The only concern for us is that it was a bit pricey. This is probably due to the proximity of the Landing, but overall we didn't have a problem paying for a King room. The room size was ok for a non-suite. It was nice to have a comfortable sofa in the room when we did not want to sit on the bed. The only issue worth mentioning with the room was the shower pressure. The room was a shower-only feature, and I assumed the shower pressure would have been much stronger. After several attempts to adjust the showerhead, I realize that it was not going to be a good result. Overall, it was a good stay for an extended night in the Branson area. The staff was extremely nice, the room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. I would definitely stay here again if I were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Yes to this hotel and I am very picky!”
Reviews.Author: krod61
Reviews.Content: We visited for the weekend and had a great time in Branson. The hotel has a great location in the middle of old downtown and the boardwalk. It was very clean, quiet, and accomodating. We brought our small dog and they were very curtious about it. The fee was $75.00 (per stay) which I thought was a little pricy but as I stated they were very nice about it. I am a bit of a "germaphobe" but felt very comfortable at this hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience we ever had”
Reviews.Author: RobbieLincoln
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review since October. We had never stayed in a suite with a kitchen and a bedroom that closed off before. We got a really good deal that particular weekend and I think our room average somewhat over $100 per night. It was like a one-bedroom apartment. The decorating was gorgeous and everything was comfortable and nice. We had a few weird maintenance issues like the spa tub not working right, light bulbs out, etc., but they fixed them. I like being able to re-use my towels to conserve water, but I would like to have more lighting over the bathroom mirror. I'd also rather not pay extra for parking. But knowing these things I'd still fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the best in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: lextonsmom
Reviews.Content: We arrived during a very busy time of the year, only to find that our room had been booked incorrecly. The hotel desk explained they were at 95% capacity. We needed a king with a pull out for a child and they quickly took care of the mix up. We stayed on the 11th floor facing the lake. To "fix" the problem, they gave us free parking and reduced the rate of the room, which I thought was very nice. We also had an older couple with us and they were also impressed. It was beautiful! The lobby is very comfortable with fire places and a waterfall. The rooms are amazing with high ceilings and beautiful fixtures and the beds are extrememly comfortable. Our room had a bath tub, but the other room only had a shower (I wish they would have told us that as the older couple would have liked to have a bath tub). The pool is small, but very neat. My son enjoyed that it was only 4 foot deep so he could walk all over the pool. The hot tub was also nice and the chairs were comfy and they provided amazing pool towels. Another plus is the gym has a glass wall so you can work out and watch your kids in the pool at the same time. We also went to the restaurant inside the hotel for an evening snack. We had the cheese fondue, which was amazing as well as a delicious dessert. It was very reasonably priced and it was great to be able to stay inside the hotel as it was cool outside. The shopping around this hotel is endless with quaint antique shops as well as easy access to the Landing. It is within walking distance of multiple restaurants and fun little things to do. It is also very accessible to everything on the strip and did not take long to get to our shows, etc. We have been going to Branson for 20+ years and this was by far the best lodging experience that we have ever had! I would recommend it to anyone that was looking to stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Branson”
Reviews.Author: supportALS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the end of the Branson strip. Thank God...We didn't go for Branson and it's shows. We stayed here on our way to Silver Dollar City. At this hotel you walk out and are at the town square with it's neat little shops, an outside mall with some stores you now, but mostly stores that are independently owned. Nice... Eateries are great, service at this hotel was great from start to finish. Quiet, rooms are large and roomy, we had a king and the kids had a double queen, both had plenty of room as did the bathrooms. As we were driving in to Silver Dollar City, we laughed as we passed the people leaving the showy area of Branson in the miles of one lane traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karenpStLouis
Reviews.Content: This was a girls shopping trip to Branson. We stayed here because my daughter got a great rate!! The hotel is beautiful inside! Our room was spacious and an extra bonus of robes in the closet! We didnt use them, but a nice touch! This hotel is an easy walk to to Branson Landing, which was nice, since we had our mother with us! Not crazy about having to pay to park ($8.00)..I just think for the price you pay for hotels, parking should be included. The hot tub and pool were open till 11 pm, which was nice. We did take advantage of the hot tub after shopping all day. The breakfast buffet was kind of pricey, I thought ($15.00) for what they had. We opted to eat breakfast at a place on the Landing. The staff here was wonderful!! Went out of their way to be friendly! We needed a corkscrew for a bottle of wine we had brought, and room service had it there within minutes! The bellman loaded up our car for us when it was time to leave! Overall---great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “NIce place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingLowOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hilton Branson Convention Center for a get-away weekend. The hotel is very nice, swimming pools were heated, fitness center was very nice, and the and the the rooms were very comfortable. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay. The dislikes were the parking fees ($8 for parking per day), $12 fee for internet in the hotel rooms, and the customer services was nice, but not accomdating like other Hilton hotel chains such as Hampton Inn and Embassy Suites. It may be also important to know that our hotel room only had a shower so if traveling with children you may need to request a room with a bath. The location is great and everything is new. Overall, we had a wonderful stay, but be aware of the additional costs and do not expect the service to be as accomodating as in other Hilton hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: ASU_RT
Reviews.Content: Having traveled to Branson many, many times since the late 1980s, I have visited a lot of the hotels in town. When I was last in Branson, I spent the bulk of my time shopping and dining in Branson Landing. I decided that I would stay downtown for a Labor Day weekend family trip in order to be close to the Landing. I found a good deal on Hotels.com that allowed us to pay for two nights at the Hilton and receive a third night for free. I had seen the Hilton when I was in Branson the past two times, but hadn't ventured into the lobby. When I arrived late Friday evening, I was very impressed with the level of service and the hotel lobby. The entire hotel is decorated in a modern/rustic style that is perfectly fitting for both the 21st century and the Ozark Mountains. We checked in quickly and made it to our room. The room was decorated nicely and was very spacious. We booked a King bed and were given a corner room. The view was very nice and I must say that the Hilton is definitely the most modern hotel in Branson. The level of service was excellent. Front desk staff and valet attendants were both very helpful. Room service was great too! Breakfast was delivered on time and the staff took extra care when delivering the wine we requested one evening. Being located beside Branson Landing was definitely a plus. The hotel is located downtown, so it isn't on the strip where most tourist attractions are located. But the downtown location is convenient to access the time saver routes that can get you to the area of the strip you wish to visit quite quickly. Paying for valet parking is a bit of a downer, but I didn't mind not having to find a parking place. The valet retrieved the car quickly whenever we needed it. I look forward to staying at the Hilton again on a my future trips to the Branson/Lakes area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jpmorg
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Hilton located in downtown Branson (connected to Convention Center). Comfortable rooms in a modern hotel. The hotel is located directly across the street from Branson Landing and just around the corner from downtown Branson shopping & dining. A little pricy, but the convenience of being close to great dining and entertainment made it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Modern Hotel in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: kansasjayhawkmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hilton during the 4th of July holiday this year while celebrating with family. The hotel was very nice, and well exceeded my expectations for any hotel in Branson, and for that matter was nicer than most Hiltons that we have stayed in in the past. We had a corner room on the 4th floor with a view toward old downtown and windows on two sides of the room. The king sized bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom very modern and clean. I especially appreciated the fact that the bathroom had a large stand-up shower instead of the usual shower-tub combo. It was much slicker than the traditional hotel tub, and much larger as well! The A/C worked very well, which was a plus as it was very warm that weekend and my wife and I like to sleep in the cold! The location is also very nice, being just across the street from The Landing. All in all, this hotel exceeded my expectations and I would most certainly stay there again the next time I am in Branson! Cons: 1. The fitness center could be larger 2. Would be nice if they provided free internet, but you know this going in 3. Would be nice if parking were cheaper than $8, but all in all it is cheaper than most hotels in major cities

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with cheaper options available”
Reviews.Author: ladybug4158
Reviews.Content: The large, nicely decorated suite had noise issues of an annoying high pitched motor whine and chairs moving across the slate type floor from above. Parking was $8 per night at their garage across the street. Walking a block to park free at the end of the convention center was worth it. Sunday buffet breakfast was very nice, but when questioned, a cheaper price was available if only cold items from the buffet were selected. The prices quoted by the front desk on daily Internet use did not match the cost on login nor the bill. It is sometimes worth it to question if there are other options available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WeDo26_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Convention Center hotel for a family celebration- my in-laws' 50th wedding anniversary. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff smiled and said 'hello' every time we passed them. The room was clean and QUIET! We rarely heard any noise in the halls even though the hotel was full with a convention going on. Although we did not eat at the onsite restaurant it was beautiful and the Sunday morning breakfast buffet looked amazing (unfortunately we weren't able to stay for it!). The beds were very comfortable with pillows and linens of high quality. The only disappointment was that given the price of the hotel, they did not offer a "free" business center to check email. They charged a minium of $5 and that only bought you 10 minutes. This hotel is very conveniently located at The Landing where the shopping and restaurant choices are great. All our requests were granted and met with wonderful customer service. My in-laws were charged for a movie that they did not order and the fee was removed without hesitation when brought to the attention of the front desk staff. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: USAtravelAlabama
Reviews.Content: We had rented a condo in Branson for a week and arrived a day early. We decided to stay at the Hilton at Branson Landing. What a delightful, pleasant surprise. This is an excellent hotel. The lobby was inviting and the staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless, modern, and fresh, with a nice balcony overlooking Branson Landing. The bed was very comfortable and the linens heavenly. The bathroom was a nice size and all amenties were in order. We were extremely tired upon arrival so we ordered room service. The food arrived in a timely manner and was very tastey. The next morning before checking out we walked Branson Landing and part of historic downtown Branson. The 35 annual Plume Nellie Hillbilly Festival and Craft show was going on and that too was in walking distance from the hotel. The price was extremely reasonable for a Hilton Hotel. The only negative about this hotel is that it charged $8 for parking. But because the price of the room was so low it was easier to accept. I would certainly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Hotel With Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HistorictravelerKC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a convention. The guest rooms were clean and spacious and the beds very comfortable. The hotel offered all the usual amenities for a larger hotel and overall the staff was friendly and helpful. The property has a great location near Branson Landing which features shopping and good restaurants. We did think the costs for high speed internet and parking were rather high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel - but staff could use more training.”
Reviews.Author: DickJane82
Reviews.Content: It seemed that the motel staff were a little confused when it came to available rooms. We checked in and had no problem, but heard that others did have problems - one in particular was checked into a room already occuppied. One night our door was opened - we were glad the safety latch was latched. We think it may have been staff since our key card still worked the next day. Didn't like the lack of free internet in our room. Also, the three nights we were there, one of the elevators was out of order the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: familyseekinginfo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Convention Center for a quick weekend trip. It was a great hotel, close to shopping and restaurants. Since this hotel is so close to The Landing you can walk to shopping and eating. Hotel was very clean, staff friendly and ready to get anything that you needed. Really enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton”
Reviews.Author: woolybooger
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of all the Hilton brands, but this Hilton is extremely nice. The rooms are contemperary with tall ceilings and floor to ceiling windows. The staff was eager to help. The hotel is right across the street from the Landing. Compared to the horrible hotel we stayed in the last time on the strip, this was great!! This will be our new stay when we are in town. IF I were to have a complaint, it would be that we had to pay $8 per day for parking and internet access was not free. Even the flea bags on the strip have free internet!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: whino
Reviews.Content: Immaculate hotel-probably the cleanest place we've ever stayed! The staff went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class all round!!!Everything you know a Hilton hotel to be :)”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nd0ct0r
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful!!! I just got back home from the hotel today and boy what a trip. The staff were a treat from the bell men to the 1st lady at the desk, it was like being at home away from home. The ambience, a beauty to the eyes. The food, soooooooooh good especially the breakfast, there was such great selection. The restaurant staff were very friendly and made the experience there memorable. The rooms: decor all in top form, we had Crabtree toiletries. My room had a balcony where I could sit and just chill out. There was a gym on site and an outdoor and indoor pool as well. I had missed my connection flight into Branson the day before and was expecting to be charged for the night I did not turn up but Hilton held up integrity and charged only for the nights I stayed there. I was sad to leave and would go back again at the next opportunity. Thumbs up!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rooms with a View”
Reviews.Author: shometravelnut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently took her parents to Branson for the weekend and we stayed at the Branson Landing Hilton. We requested a high floor with a view of the lake and were not disappointed. My wife and I stayed in room 1019 which is a one bedroom suite with a kitchen and dining area overlooking lake Taneycomo. We actually saw a float plane fly by our room and then land on the lake. Very Cool. My wife’s parents stayed in room 1105 and it has two queen beds and is very roomy. The beds were ultra comfy and both rooms were decorated with very updated styles. I think the Hilton here is pretty new and everything looks that way. We walked across the street to the Branson Landing mall and had everything we could want for shopping, food and entertainment. We are already planning on going back in the spring and we'll request the same rooms again. They were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: BLAKE9972
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in early September and loved everything about this hotel. The condo was everything we could have wanted. It was very clean and beautifully decorated. The staff was very accommodating. I loved the fact that the kitchen was fully stocked with dishwasher, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffeepot, and dishes. They kept the coffee supplied along with liquid and dry creamers, sugar, etc. We had a wonderful time here celebrating our 36th anniversary. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: rita_from_wentzville
Reviews.Content: I am staying here for a conference! So far I love everything! The mattress is so comfortable! I slept well the first night which I rarely do in a hotel. Minor things: only one trash can in the room and it is in the bathroom. They would probably bring me another one if I asked for it! Also the internet is only free in the lobby and I believe on the 2nd floor. It is $9.95 per 24 hour period in the room. Again this is a minor detail! I enjoy being right across the street from the Branson Landing! Lots of shops and restaurants! There is a nice water display set to music every hour!

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton is tops”
Reviews.Author: clover0310
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Branson Convention Center for 2 nights. I had asked for early check-in and arrived at the hotel at 2:45 PM. Not only was my room ready but I had a view of Branson Landing Mall and Lake Taneycomo. I used the valet parking and the attendent was great as was the bellman who took my luggage after a 9 hour drive. The lobby is beautiful and relaxing with a water feature, concierge desk and places to just sit and soak it all in. The elevators were quiet and seemed to be always available. My room was on the 5th floor and had 2 quenn beds. The beds had wonderful linens and a mattress which one did not need to get used to in order to get a good night's sleep. There was a chair and ottoman by the windows too. The room has a large flat screen TV with access to pay per view movies and Nintendo games for the kids. You can easily block any or all of these items using your remote control if you don't want anything ordered by accident. The bathroom is large with a granite countertop. I do agree with the other reviewer comments on the bathroom lighting. It is difficult to see when trying to do hair or makeup. The towels are large, soft and fluffy. Best towels I've ever used in a hotel. We did not eat at the Hilton preferring to walk to the Landing for more choices. In addition, I was never able to find the hotel's coffee area, Java Jive, open. The literature stated it opened at 6 AM and stated no closing time, yet everytime I walked through the lobby area, it was closed. The pools and fitness center were amazing. An indoor pool and spa as well as an outdoor pool and spa. It was great. The fitness center has Precor machines so you have no excuse to not keep up on your workout. I booked my room using the Hilton site and got a AAA rate. I've stayed in Branson several times now and this is hands down, my favorite hotel. For a short trip, it was very relaxing and peaceful and I would stay there again as long as I could get a great rate. Here's hoping the Hilton continues to give travelers a great retreat!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. Every detail took my breath away. I travel on business at least once a month so I stay at a lot of hotels, so for me to give a hotel such a glowing review is rare. The room was immaculate! Not a speck of dirty anywhere. Fantastic bed, it reminded me of a much more expensive Westin property. The convention facilities were just as amazing. It’s right across the street from excellent shopping and restaurants. You will also be walking distance from quaint Ozark type shops. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “What a meal”
Reviews.Author: Julia R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were just in Branson for our anniversary and we ate at the Hilton Hotels restaurant. What an amazing meal. All the attention was on detail. The decor is beautiful,new,modern, contemporary. The staff wonderful and the food was beautiful and amazingly yummy. I would definately recommend this restaurant at the Hilton to anyone who would like to have a nice, delicious meal in Branson and not in a food chain restaurant on hwy 76

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: ninitreat
Reviews.Content: Top of the Line in Service, Cleanliness, Comfort. This is an experience you Must make a priority. The train station is directly below the rooms. Shopping is right out the door. We have been staying in Branson three times a year for the past 30 years. There are many attractions in the area, this is one in itself. We had two rooms reserved. We asked for one to be upgraded for our children's anniverssary and were given a suite that was like a luxury condo. Two flat screen tvs. That helped when the men wanted to watch the basketball playoffs and the kids wanted to watch a movie. Nice pools. You feel so special. HINT: get take out and stay in the room. You want to spend every moment in the room. Parking is right outside. Please, treat yourself. It is worth every penny. The staff was the greatest! No place compares with the beds. We will make this an annual event.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justsay-n
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at the Hilton. They made us feel special from the moment we walked in till the moment we left. Everything was perfect in the room. But our favorite thing was the bed. It is great!! Not to soft, not to hard. I understand that they are made special just for the Hilton. Only one small problem, check out is at 11am and housekeep was knocking on our door at 9:45am to see if we were out yet or not. However, I can totally understand it was Easter morning. I am sure they wanted to be w/their families. Overall, we would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Does Again!”
Reviews.Author: surfergal0002
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dazzling! From its first impression as the valet attendant whisks my vehicle away and another leads me into the stunning lobby, I was distracted by so many wonders! Finally, an elegant yet comfortable hotel in Branson where nature meets urban. A perfect balance for the area. A much needed facility, with its large convention center, this place is bound to become a haven for many business travellers and companies that need to book large meetings. The rooms were high-tech, comtemporary meets rugged as each Hilton is designed specifically for its location. Branson is a step back in time as people come from all over to meet the past and see shows, crafts, and experience life of yesteryear. However, although history draws visitors here, visitors still need to have the modern offerings of the high tech world that we live in. It's not only an excellent place for business guests but those who are there for pure FUN! With in-room on demand movies, room service, state-of-the-art fitness center, indoor and heated outdoor pools and hot tubs, and amazing dining, those who come to have a great time will find it at the Hilton. I didn't know how it would work bringing the two worlds together but Hilton does it again in its own style!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Branson Convention Center for a quick getaway to see the Christmas lights at Silver Dollar City and shop the new Branson Landing...Hotel is very nice, clean, modern furntiure - staff was great at the front desk...did not like the $8 parking fee..Also, restaurant staff could have been better - would stay again.
